qas.question: In Shia tariqah, what are the Twelvers commonly known as?
What are the Nizari Ismailis more commonly known as?
What are the Mustalian Ismailis commonly known as?
Which tariah is known as the Fivers?

context: The Shia tariqah with a majority of adherents are the Twelvers who are commonly known as <a0_0>the "Shia"<a0_0/>. After that come the Nizari Ismailis commonly known as the <a1_0>Ismailis<a1_0/>; and then come the Mustalian Ismailis commonly known as the "<a2_0>Bohras<a2_0/>" with further schisms within their Bohri tariqah. The Druze tariqah (very small in number today) initially were of the Fatimid Ismailis and separated from them (the Fatimid Ismailis) after the death of the Fatimid Imam and Caliph Hakim Bi Amrillah. <a3_0>The Shia Sevener<a3_0/> tariqah no longer exists. Another small tariqah is the <a4_0>Zaidi Shias<a4_0/>, also known as the Fivers and who do not believe in The Occultation of their last Imam.
